name: Nekomata
description:
'Nekomata' artwork were adapted from Japanese dark folktale creature named Nekomata, which is originally found in the demon forest of Hokkaido. 

Some sources say that Nekomata is a god of death pet that described as a big cat who has a forked tails and a habit of preying on corpses and souls of the dead. 
In addition, Nekomata is believed to have the ability to resurrect the dead and the ability to shapeshift into a human form.


Apart from various rumors who said that Nekomata often prey on living humans and spread plague to the humans around as a reflection of the cruelty that humans have committed on their domestic cats. 
Some of Nekomata characteristics and closeness which is identical with their ability to interact with supernatural and inter-dimensional things are very similar with several cultures beliefs which say that cats are one of the animals that are able to open gates with other worlds and often become mediators between humans with their dead predecessors, as well as a multidimension messenger from the ancestors who already long gone.
And you might also familiar with the myth of the 9 lives possessed by cats.
